title: Gold Ends Down Week on Lower Note
excerpt: Gold settled down down 1.1% Friday, and silver fell 2.2%, with both metals also posting losses for the week.
text: 1445 ET – Front-month gold futures finish down 1.1% to $3,334 a troy ounce, making the third daily session that gold finishes lower and the second straight week that gold has recorded a decline. The stronger U.S. dollar was the main pressure point for gold futures, says ADM Investor Services in a note. “Progress in tradetalks between the U.S. and E.U. sparked an increase in risk appetite,” says the firm. “Solid U.S. economic data also weighed on gold.” Gold fell 0.6% for the week. (kirk.maltais@wsj.com)Comex Gold Ends the Week 0.57% Lower at $3334.00Front Month Comex Gold for July delivery lost $19.00 per troy ounce, or 0.57% to $3334.00 this weekCopyright ©2025 Dow Jones & Company, Inc. 1445 ET – Front-month gold futures finish down 1.1% to $3,334 a troy ounce, making the third daily session that gold finishes lower and the second straight week that gold has recorded a decline. The stronger U.S. dollar was the main pressure point for gold futures, says ADM Investor Services in a note. “Progress in tradetalks between the U.S. and E.U. sparked an increase in risk appetite,” says the firm. “Solid U.S. economic data also weighed on gold.” Gold fell 0.6% for the week. (kirk.maltais@wsj.com)

Comex Gold Ends the Week 0.57% Lower at $3334.00

Front Month Comex Gold for July delivery lost $19.00 per troy ounce, or 0.57% to $3334.00 this week
